game_description: Immerse yourself in the meditative and tranquil worlds of our THZZLS, where time slows down. Journey into past centuries to explore historical cultural artifacts. DER BAZAR Step into the enchanting world of "DER BAZAR", an extraordinary VR paper theatre. Immerse yourself in the nostalgia of old-fashioned rooms as you carefully arrange furniture and props according to vintage pictures. Each room is meticulously designed to capture the essence of 19th century Germany, showcasing authentic objects sourced from the renowned German lifestyle magazine "DER BAZAR", which was published in the vibrant city of Berlin. DIE FISCHE Next up, let us introduce you to "DIE FISCHE". Step into a realm of mesmerising beauty as you discover an exquisite collection of illustrations featuring majestic fish from the 18th-century. Engage with them in an interactive and immersive experience that will surely leave you delighted. DIE SCHMETTERLINGE Have you always wanted to catch some butterflies? Well, here's your opportunity! In this level you will be transported into nature and surrounded by butterflies. Your task is to catch these exquisite creatures and place them into their corresponding silhouettes to witness a magical transformation. Each butterfly featured in the game is a stunning original 19th-century illustration, enhancing the beauty of the experience. The best part? You don't need any controllers to navigate these remarkable worlds. Your own hands will serve as your guide.
review_1: This VR game, set in 19th century Germany, offers a unique and immersive experience, transporting players to a rich historical era. The puzzle-solving mechanics, featuring 19th century German people and furniture, provide an enjoyable challenge. The controls are easy to grasp, and I like the fact that it works without controllers, just with hand tracking. It also works offline. Overall, it's a great VR experience that history enthusiasts and puzzle lovers will appreciate. Edit: There are now new levels with fish and butterfly puzzles that I am looking forward to trying out.
review_2: First of all I appreciate how the instructions for use are in quick visuals ( I learned how to use my hand tracking quickly by controller placement). The articulation you can perform with the puzzle pieces while hand tracking is beautifully executed. I appreciate the fact that you can take a puzzle piece and bring it up close to glance at the 1800's art (gives me classic carnival faire feels). All levels promise to have a look and feel for their theme. Overall a very immersive experience for a classically relaxing pastime.
review_3: Very simple game with a unique look. Puzzling through the 19th century fashion and design is fun and meditative.
